area_name: Nod (formerly submitted as The Fable), The

climbs.name: With Cheese
climbs.fa: Tim Mannschreck, Roe Green, Steve McCorkel

content.description:
With Cheese, 5.10d**. This is the center crack. Start with

La Royal

and add the 'special sauce'. Fire over the bulge and straight up the crack to the top. This is interesting to protect.
content.protection: Bolts, small, medium and large cams with a few wires. Runners to reduce drag.

content.description: Climb the splitter crack on the east face of The Nod.
content.location: It is right around the corner from the other Nod routes.

climbs.name: Pulp Friction
climbs.fa: Tim Mannschreck, Roe Green, Steve McCorkel

content.description:
Pulp Friction, 5.11b/c*. This is an alternate start to

Moment of Clarity

. Start as

La Royal

again, but at the bulge stem, smear and reach around to the right and find a 2.5" crack in a small right-facing dihedral. Climb this, then undercling to the second bolt and the rest of

MOC

.
content.protection: Bolts, small, medium and large cams with a few wires. Runners to reduce drag.
content.location:
The alternate start for

Moment of Clarity

.  Start as for

La Royal

.

climbs.name: Moment of Clarity
climbs.fa: Tim Mannschreck, Roe Green, Steve McCorkel

content.description: Plug a couple of cams in a 3" crack almost directly under the arête, and belay. Carefully traverse left to the South side and the first bolt. Place a small cam after the first bolt. Clip bolts the rest of the way, with an optional hidden small cam (blue Metolius) possible near the top to reduce the run-out (5.9) to the two-bolt anchor. The arête, half way up, can be climbed either directly on the arête or on the face to the left, the left being a little harder.
content.protection: Bolts, small, medium and large cams with a few wires. Runners to reduce drag.
content.location: A crack almost directly under the arete.

climbs.name: La Royal
climbs.fa: Tim Mannschreck, Roe Green, Steve McCorkel

content.description:
La Royal, 5.10a*. This is the left-angling crack in the face as seen from below, requiring gear and some willingness for extra adventure. Continue traversing past then down after the first bolt of

MOC

. Make a belay. Take the short acute dihedral above placing a #1 Friend inside before the committing move. Arrive underneath a bulge, follow a crack traversing up and left to the top.
content.protection: Bolts, small, medium and large cams with a few wires. Runners to reduce drag.
content.location: The left-angling crack in the face.

pathTokens: Nod (formerly submitted as The Fable), The
